we want to drop the _normalization completely it is necessary to expose 
attributes under old used names (which are not really fitting naming

- add _attributes_iterator to de-duplicate logic in Resource

commit_message:
Add access alias (aka) for the resource attributes

In the compute.server we are currently exposing names, which are only 
"aliases" for known attributes (i.e. accessIPv4 vs access_ipv4). Since 
we want to drop the _normalization completely it is necessary to expose 
attributes under old used names (which are not really fitting naming 
convention of the resource attributes). So add a "aka" to the 
BaseComponent.
While we are here 
- repair some of the resource accesses from the unittests (i.e. direct 
conversion to dict), 
- update local dict storage, so that json.dumps works on update 
resource. Actually also fix the existing problem in the code with that.
- add _attributes_iterator to de-duplicate logic in Resource
- what a wonderful bug - passing sha256 as md5 (affects nodepool 
heavily). Add also tests for that.

Change-Id: I39edfc8fe4e4f6c216663c0e7602c9f1bec5cab4

Set xenapi_use_agent to "False" instead of false

Set it that way.

Task: #33637

commit_message:
Added sink unit tests

We had no coverage of the base sink. This add some basic
tests, as well as a fake notification handler that can be
used for testing.

Change-Id: Ie8657aacd22737f9ebaac4af4b34030e12ab18d0

messages:
[{'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2019-02-13 09:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-13 09:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-02-18 23:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Not approving as this may need a coordinated cut over.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-19 02:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It looks like https://bugs.launchpad.net/karbor and https://bugs.launchpad.net/karbor-dashboard have bugs which should be imported. Please get up with me (fungi) in IRC to work out when you want to have the cutover happen.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-08 18:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Jiao, please see Jeremy's comment and act."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-06-06 19:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Jiao, please see comments and react...'}, {'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2019-06-11 09:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Jiao, please see comments and react...

Thanks for reminder me, I will contact with fungi on irc quickly.'}, {'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2019-06-11 11:55:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It looks like https://bugs.launchpad.net/karbor and
 > https://bugs.launchpad.net/karbor-dashboard have bugs which should
 > be imported. Please get up with me (fungi) in IRC to work out when
 > you want to have the cutover happen.

Hi fungi, I don't know if you get my 'ping' on irc. Bugs on the launchpad are too old now (or some of them are not useful, but I have no right to mark them ), so I think we do not need import them on storyboard. We can start using storyboard now. Let's start a new day for karbor :) thanks very much"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-06-11 15:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This should be fine to merge now in that case. Thanks for following up!

You may also want to consider adding these three projects to a common karbor project-group (using a "groups" list in each project specifying "karbor" as the only list entry), but that can be done with a new change any time in the future.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-06-11 15:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, I still strongly encourage you to reach out to the administrators listed at https://launchpad.net/~karbor-drivers/+members and see if one of them can get you added to that group so that you can update the project descriptions on launchpad and close down bug reporting there to avoid future confusion. See https://docs.openstack.org/infra/storyboard/migration.html#recently-migrated for recommendations.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-06-11 16:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Since this appears to require a rebase to be able to merge, I'm going to take the initiative to add a "karbor" project group for you while I'm doing that.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-06-11 16:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-06-11 16:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Reapproving now.'}]

Since we're obviously not keeping this up to date, a probably better patch would be to add some documentation to that file to say what is in there are just examples and normally what you would test is the target being 'master' and the base being whatever master-1 is."}]

commit_message:
Support devstack's global virtualenvs

Devstack may be moving to global virtualenvs due to cahnges in upstream
python package tooling that make it impractical to continue installing
all of the packages against the system python. Instead we use global
virtualenvs which give us coinstallation testing but require we
explicitly support things in funny paths.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558930
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/559811
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/559856
Change-Id: I6f62da4d521494dfd6caba8098682a6558a32126

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-11 15:12:00.000000000', 'message': 'Remove glean config for OVH nodes

OVH updated its infra in order to have correct network_data.json given
by metadata API and / or config drive.

So glean override for this is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: Id97aceb78019b7b71bc231778d7ea7e0f3964e0d
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove glean config for OVH nodes

OVH updated its infra in order to have correct network_data.json given
by metadata API and / or config drive.

So glean override for this is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: Id97aceb78019b7b71bc231778d7ea7e0f3964e0d
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 16:46:47.000000000', 'message': 'luks: Default to LUKS v1 when formatting volumes

cryptsetup 2.0.6 has started to default to LUKS v2 or LUKS2 when
formatting volumes.  However QEMU currently has no support for v2 and
will fail to open the volume when being used to natively decrypt.

For now we should default the original LUKS encryptor to v1 when
formatting volumes, introducing a new LUKS2 encryptor and encryption
constant in a future change.

Closes-bug: 1831994
Change-Id: I152fe10ff5a3131950b789d3fd4efa15c554ff09
(cherry picked from commit 94312bd90fe42a870b4f098e00ddd9ff2aacd1bb)
'}]
commit_message:
luks: Default to LUKS v1 when formatting volumes

cryptsetup 2.0.6 has started to default to LUKS v2 or LUKS2 when
formatting volumes.  However QEMU currently has no support for v2 and
will fail to open the volume when being used to natively decrypt.

For now we should default the original LUKS encryptor to v1 when
formatting volumes, introducing a new LUKS2 encryptor and encryption
constant in a future change.

Closes-bug: 1831994
Change-Id: I152fe10ff5a3131950b789d3fd4efa15c554ff09
(cherry picked from commit 94312bd90fe42a870b4f098e00ddd9ff2aacd1bb)

commit_message:
Add neutron-api for lib/neutron enabling

As neutron and stadium projects have adopted lib/neutron for some
jobs, but still using lib/neutron-legacy for grenade jobs, just adding
a check for neutron-api, q-svc will be ready to removed only when all the
grenade jobs have adapted lib/neutron.

Change-Id: I9f8c4d7e111a266584b6b10ac5c86c6347345010

commit_message:
Change host for osapi and metadata services in db.

Currently db records for nova-osapi_compute and nova-metadata
services in nova.services table takes host value from osapi_compute_listen
and metadata_listen options from nova.conf. This patch changes that value
to hostname.

Closes-Bug: #1631430

Change-Id: I484a2b70e2a5513200f75a436c964f89f0467c84

commit_message:
Devstack-gate changes to enable n-api on subnode

Enable n-api on subnode in multinode environment to test
zero downtime upgrade when DEVSTACK_GATE_NOVA_ENABLE_API_SUBNODE
is set.

Change-Id: I1b257cfe7c6aec7f999824a1510b4edc63167e80
Depends-On: I74574ae9f45a74bcbcc8e3149228ecb795ab4fb7
Co-Authored-by: Anusha Unnam <anusha.unnam@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add post hook script to run tempest with old n-api

This script tests if old n-api is compatible with new controller services
which is needed to prove zero downtime upgrade process.

During the zero downtime upgrade process, old n-api should communicate
well with new controller services. This script tests this scenario.

This script is called in zero-downtime-upgrade experimental gate job and
is tested in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/419066/. In the gate job,
after grenade upgrades the controller node, this script is called to
change nova endpoint to n-api on the subnode and run tempest smoke tests.

Change-Id: I7ac4744927395e300205e0f2283b7f2828f431d6
Depends-On: I1b257cfe7c6aec7f999824a1510b4edc63167e80
Co-Authored-by: Anusha Unnam <anusha.unnam@intel.com>

commit_message:
Switching to python 3 with the docs build

As latest Sphinx is requiring python 3 this patch sets basepython to
python 3 in the [testenv] section of tox.ini to make sure that is what
the environment is using so we don't need to pin the Sphinx version.

Change-Id: I217ee30359719ab3793b1329ec5e3f1a03848b8f

commit_message:
Exclude constants from autodoc

Since the 2.1.0 release of Sphinx, the docs fail to build because of the
warnings-treated-as-errors of the now autodoc'd imported external
modules[1]. This change configures sphinx-autodoc to ignore those
constants so that the docs can build and the documentation from the
external modules isn't included in keystone's.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/6447

Change-Id: I7b1c2c740727446d5460dc0025e47e0e9b388d10
(cherry picked from commit 485a6b2170fe7d62a7ce9b29ccd874ed0f280d77)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Checksum Validation

PowerMax for Cinder now features checksum validation checks on
driver initialisation for verification of downstream driver
files against upstream driver files.

Change-Id: I8d2934bb7b25c0d839428c8cf2c6ea59e5346f3b
Implements: blueprint powermax-checksum

subject: Make project volume group table work even with volumev3 only env
messages: [{'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-06-07 10:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-06-07 19:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-06-11 13:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 10:26:32.000000000', 'message': "Make project volume group table work even with volumev3 only env

Previously the volume group table in the project dashboard checked if
'volume' endpoint is available and 'volumev3' endpoint was not checked.
'volumev3' is an endpoint name commonly used for Volume v3 API and
it is not surprising that only volumev3 is configured in deployments,
so we should ensure that horizon works with environments only with
'volumev3' endpoint.

The service endpoints are already checked in panel.py, so there is no
need to have the permission check (i.e., service check) in the table.

Similar patterns are found in tables in project/snapshots and
project/vg_snapshots. They are also cleanup by this commit.

Change-Id: I12d03745bec5d8dec10a8e2b4306c595f2f39560
Closes-Bug: #1829461
(cherry picked from commit 0cb5167b99d418c7ce8cbc9adda24f228fdd42d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Make project volume group table work even with volumev3 only env

Previously the volume group table in the project dashboard checked if
'volume' endpoint is available and 'volumev3' endpoint was not checked.
'volumev3' is an endpoint name commonly used for Volume v3 API and
it is not surprising that only volumev3 is configured in deployments,
so we should ensure that horizon works with environments only with
'volumev3' endpoint.

The service endpoints are already checked in panel.py, so there is no
need to have the permission check (i.e., service check) in the table.

Similar patterns are found in tables in project/snapshots and
project/vg_snapshots. They are also cleanup by this commit.

Change-Id: I12d03745bec5d8dec10a8e2b4306c595f2f39560
Closes-Bug: #1829461
(cherry picked from commit 0cb5167b99d418c7ce8cbc9adda24f228fdd42d0)

commit_message:
Add the group_snapshot attribute to the snapshot in UpdateRow

On snpashot panel in admin dashboards,
The group_snapshot attribute is required in the snapshot table,
but it does not exist in UpdateRow.

This patch Add the group_snapshot attribute to the snapshot

Change-Id: I00fc431fa3c5b8da40e5b24507165a2f3dfead47
Closes-Bug: #1831435

subject: Make sure we pass the proper new pcs 0.10 variables
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-06-11 06:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-06-11 10:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncheck-rdo'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-06-11 11:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-11 06:05:04.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we pass the proper new pcs 0.10 variables

With I852d5d7aa8578c45f0c7215827cedd4ea72c8d0b we will now
use the new system to create pacemaker remotes when pcs 0.10
is installed on the system (RHEL/Centos >=8). This new
way of doing things requires the remotes to set up pcsd
and so we need to pass the same pcs user and password that
are used by pacemaker itself to the remote resource.

Tested on an IHA OSP15 deployment and got a successful deployment.

Depends-On: I852d5d7aa8578c45f0c7215827cedd4ea72c8d0b
Change-Id: I02a8c1d618b11f68f9272b9044ff81ac39d6a81b
(cherry picked from commit 16c5f1692580d7fc42985d8895828eb71433af09)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure we pass the proper new pcs 0.10 variables

With I852d5d7aa8578c45f0c7215827cedd4ea72c8d0b we will now
use the new system to create pacemaker remotes when pcs 0.10
is installed on the system (RHEL/Centos >=8). This new
way of doing things requires the remotes to set up pcsd
and so we need to pass the same pcs user and password that
are used by pacemaker itself to the remote resource.

Tested on an IHA OSP15 deployment and got a successful deployment.

Depends-On: I852d5d7aa8578c45f0c7215827cedd4ea72c8d0b
Change-Id: I02a8c1d618b11f68f9272b9044ff81ac39d6a81b
(cherry picked from commit 16c5f1692580d7fc42985d8895828eb71433af09)

[{'created': '2019-06-10 13:26:07.000000000', 'message': 'Undeprecate NeutronL3HA parameter

This parameter is still useful. It was initially removed because
distributed HA routers are not supported, but there is no reason a
deployment cannot create routers that are either HA or DVR if the system
is deployed to support both. This is primarily an optics change.

Change-Id: I5f1eba5d30f392630946a5f9bf96bd2ad49c775e
'}]
commit_message:
Undeprecate NeutronL3HA parameter

This parameter is still useful. It was initially removed because
distributed HA routers are not supported, but there is no reason a
deployment cannot create routers that are either HA or DVR if the system
is deployed to support both. This is primarily an optics change.

Change-Id: I5f1eba5d30f392630946a5f9bf96bd2ad49c775e

commit_message:
Fix correct network for nova-vnc

The network for nova-vnc is not set correctly when determining
principals and hostnames for TLS certs.

Closes-Bug: #1832013
Change-Id: Ie8f31413a485c7a91a421ffeefe230a353266993

commit_message:
Run more jobs on requirements changes

Assures that we run more jobs when requirements.txt changes, because
updating them has increased risks of introducing behavior changes
that may affect some areas that are not tested by default.

Change-Id: Id70a25e9177fc706d6494bac546b3fb3b1c13dfa

commit_message:
Move 'extra_tht_configs' tasks to overcloud-deploy role

'extra_tht_configs' parameter is used to pass extra tht
configs to overcloud deploy command(using 'extra_tht_config_args'
fact), this parameter is used to modify overcloud-deploy command,
so this patch moves the tasks associated with it to overcloud-deploy
role.

Closes-Bug: #1806328
Change-Id: I4367bd554bfc06b2416fee792b5b2a91ff8f7ff8

commit_message:
Filter properties through make_v2_image_params

In the upload task workflow, we're skipping filtering the properties
through make_v2_image_properties. This is causing booleans to get
sent directly.

Change-Id: I3208789e6bc4f596d5f092138b9fee0ca5c7a27a

[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-07 19:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-06-10 02:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-06-10 07:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-10 08:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I guess this is OK. We are including the networks matching the legacy? static network-isolation scheme by default. All tough what we actually deploy by default is without any of these. 

IMO we should go the other way, remove the the networks in all roles as that is the actual default. Use '/dev/null' as network data by default as well (as is done with deploy --standalone). Then make -r and -n arguments mandatory when deploying overcloud and provide a roles_data_net_isolation.yaml for the upgraders to point at. (Now I do realize this would be a bit of work ...*)"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-10 13:31:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

I'd be ok remove it them in the future, the issue is that it currently blows up in os-net-config if they aren't defined. I think we need to handle the default better if no network configuration is provided.  We should probably fail earlier if we expect the end user to provide the network information in an alternate fashion."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-11 13:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit e5e7fea6914378977cd6b51ad8af92473fdddd23'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 19:45:38.000000000', 'message': "Add networks to Standalone role

The standalone role can be used with and without an undercloud. If you
deploy it with an undercloud and use network-isolation, then the
deployment will fail because the networks aren't defined in the role.
Since it doesn't hurt to have them on in the non-undercloud version,
lets add them back in.  They were previously removed as part of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/628265/

Change-Id: I366631cb6ecd39595c00204a02408beb431af70e
Closes-Bug: #1832043
"}]
commit_message:
Add networks to Standalone role

The standalone role can be used with and without an undercloud. If you
deploy it with an undercloud and use network-isolation, then the
deployment will fail because the networks aren't defined in the role.
Since it doesn't hurt to have them on in the non-undercloud version,
lets add them back in.  They were previously removed as part of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/628265/

Change-Id: I366631cb6ecd39595c00204a02408beb431af70e
Closes-Bug: #1832043

commit_message:
Make NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot podman compatible

With podman therefore are changes required to the libvirt-guests
unit file and how we dealt with dependencies of the containers.
With podman systemd is used to manage the containers which we now
can use for container dependencies and use libvirt-guests from
inside a container.

commit_message:
[Rocky/Queens Only] Remove pre-upgrade validation tasks in cont services.

The pre-upgrade validation tasks in the containerized services made
sense when upgrading from non-containerized to containerized overcloud
(ocata to pike), however we kept them for queens and rocky
release thinking about using them during the undercloud upgrade from
non-containerized to containerized (queens to rocky) but they
were skipped there too [0]. It's beeing observed in the current
upgrades taken place by operators, that these validations are
causing more issues than it was thought, so let's get rid of
them from all the containerized services in Queens and Rocky.

Closes-Bug: #1829858

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/stable/rocky/tripleoclient/v1/tripleo_deploy.py#L833

Change-Id: If99ea62b6cefb140a9c918b8f6a774658c52d54b
(cherry picked from commit 7e0a4d0e5282e5e3bcced9368c724ffd6042643f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 10:15:52.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 7fdd6adc7acf99e74fbe1c12606f8c867ae134ae.
and commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6.

Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
Change-Id: I7f6e686cc6d06651c94fe9fb479690858e58c65d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 7fdd6adc7acf99e74fbe1c12606f8c867ae134ae.
and commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6.

Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
Change-Id: I7f6e686cc6d06651c94fe9fb479690858e58c65d

commit_message:
Fix sporadically failing test test_with_items_action_context

* The test fails sometimes if std.http returns something like 30x
  status code. This patch fixes it by replacing std.http with
  std.async_noop. The entire module though requires revisiting
  and refactoring since lots of things don't look relevant
  anymore.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 16:58:04.000000000', 'message': 'Handle volume API failure in _post_live_migration

Previously, if the call to Cinder in _post_live_migration failed, the
exception went unhandled and prevented us from calling
post_live_migration_at_destination - which is where we set instance
host and task state. This left the system in an inconsistent state,
with the instance actually running on the destination, but
with instance.host still set to the source. This patch simply wraps
the Cinder API calls in a try/except, and logs the exception instead
of blowing up. While "dumb", this has the virtue of being simple and
minimizing potential side effects. A comprehensive refactoring of
when, where and how we set instance host and task state to try to
guarantee consistency is left as a TODO.

Conflicts in nova/compute/manager.py due to absence of new Cinder flow
conditional.

commit_message:
Handle volume API failure in _post_live_migration

Previously, if the call to Cinder in _post_live_migration failed, the
exception went unhandled and prevented us from calling
post_live_migration_at_destination - which is where we set instance
host and task state. This left the system in an inconsistent state,
with the instance actually running on the destination, but
with instance.host still set to the source. This patch simply wraps
the Cinder API calls in a try/except, and logs the exception instead
of blowing up. While "dumb", this has the virtue of being simple and
minimizing potential side effects. A comprehensive refactoring of
when, where and how we set instance host and task state to try to
guarantee consistency is left as a TODO.

Conflicts in nova/compute/manager.py due to absence of new Cinder flow
conditional (and corresponding modifications to tests).

Partial-bug: 1628606
Change-Id: Icb0bdaf454935b3713c35339394d260b33520de5
(cherry picked from commit 5513f48dea529fe4e690f50a462300129594210c)
(cherry picked from commit cf3c2f391ad0f9d2a2d94247509bcb2709413e4f)
(cherry picked from commit 53f9c8e5104076872021ed33e221e5526ca5059b)

messages:
[{'account_id': 23182, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/pike.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-06 06:59:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't see how the referred to 'from commit x' relate to this patch at all. I also don't understand why this is being done directly to queens rather than starting at master. Please provide a clearer reason for these things in the commit message.

Also, why not just add the new tasks into the post install task file?"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-06 09:54:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Indeed, this doesn't explain WHY you are adding ceilometer-upgrade task.

This is confusing. I know we've discussed on the channel, but your intent was not clear.

If you need two different bugs fixed and merged into the branch, please do two different backports."}, {'account_id': 23182, 'date': '2018-07-06 12:23:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Indeed, this doesn't explain WHY you are adding ceilometer-upgrade
 > task.
 > 
 > This is confusing. I know we've discussed on the channel, but your
 > intent was not clear.
 > 
 > If you need two different bugs fixed and merged into the branch,
 > please do two different backports.

Ceilometer with gnocchi was not working because type was not created in gnocchi. So we add this ceilometer upgrade task, it was merged into master but this task is not working in a new installation. Because two problems:
 1 ceilometer user not created when task is run (osa_ceilometer repo)
 2 gnocchi is not install yet (osa repo)

For stable branch, we don't have ceilometer upgrade tasks, so I combine it with the fix 1 here"}, {'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-07-07 05:40:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Resource list doesn't show up unless ceilometer upgrade task was run . This was experienced by couple of users  hence the patch was submitted in master. The correction in terms of ordering the user creation before the task seems logical. 
one  doubt , will it address the second problem as well or  gnocchi need to be installed before ceilometer ? re-ordering the setup-openstack playbook ?"}, {'account_id': 23182, 'date': '2018-07-07 10:10:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Resource list doesn't show up unless ceilometer upgrade task was
 > run . This was experienced by couple of users  hence the patch was
 > submitted in master. The correction in terms of ordering the user
 > creation before the task seems logical.
 > one  doubt , will it address the second problem as well or  gnocchi
 > need to be installed before ceilometer ? re-ordering the
 > setup-openstack playbook ?

Totally agree with you. The fix order is in setup-openstack so openstack/openstack-ansible, see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/Ib1f4ee5e260a042d7f2bdf1750828461e3710730"}, {'account_id': 23182, 'date': '2018-07-13 12:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:27:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Please wait until the master patch has merged before proposing backports. The master patch may still change. While that's unlikely in this case, prematurely proposing backports actually slows down the process of getting the patches in, rather than speeding things up."}, {'account_id': 23182, 'date': '2018-07-16 08:00:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Please wait until the master patch has merged before proposing
 > backports. The master patch may still change. While that's unlikely
 > in this case, prematurely proposing backports actually slows down

patch is merged to master, this change is up to date with it"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-24 20:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-24 20:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Adds ceilometer-upgrade task

Run ceilometer-upgrade task  post ceilometer installation
to create the resources in gnocchi

Implements: Additonal step to run ceilometer-upgrade during ceilometer-post-install tasks
Closes-Bug: 1737096
Closes-Bug: 1778195
(cherry picked from commit ca7cf70eafeb3be784aac9fb8ac21166fd4dbcd2)
(cherry picked from commit 9d54c79b82a3ce325b0070ffc78f4091c5e33e83)

Change-Id: I605f5527d8ae68e6a6eabbcfdd7fe0c60abd4332

messages:
[{'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-12 12:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-12 12:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

diff with upsteam manifest

https://docs.projectcalico.org/v3.3/getting-started/kubernetes/installation/hosted/kubernetes-datastore/calico-networking/1.7/calico.yaml

--- a/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/calico-service.sh
+++ b/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/calico-service.sh
@@ -232,7 +232,7 @@ spec:
       # as a host-networked pod.
       serviceAccountName: calico-node
       containers:
-      - image: ${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-docker.io/calico/}typha:v3.3.6
+      - image: calico/typha:v3.3.6
         name: calico-typha
         ports:
         - containerPort: 5473
@@ -346,7 +346,7 @@ spec:
         # container programs network policy and routes on each
         # host.
         - name: calico-node
-          image: ${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-docker.io/calico/}node:v3.3.6
+          image: calico/node:v3.3.6
           env:
             # Use Kubernetes API as the backing datastore.
             - name: DATASTORE_TYPE
@@ -386,24 +386,12 @@ spec:
                 configMapKeyRef:
                   name: calico-config
                   key: veth_mtu
-            # Set MTU for tunnel device used if ipip is enabled
-            - name: FELIX_IPINIPMTU
-              value: "1440"
             # The default IPv4 pool to create on startup if none exists. Pod IPs will be
             # chosen from this range. Changing this value after installation will have
-            # no effect. This should fall within `--cluster-cidr`.
+            # no effect. This should fall within '--cluster-cidr'.
             - name: CALICO_IPV4POOL_CIDR
-              value: ${CALICO_IPV4POOL}
-            - name: CALICO_IPV4POOL_IPIP
-              value: "off"
-            - name: CALICO_IPV4POOL_NAT_OUTGOING
-              value: "true"
-            # Set noderef for node controller.
-            - name: CALICO_K8S_NODE_REF
-              valueFrom:
-                fieldRef:
-                  fieldPath: spec.nodeName
-            # Disable file logging so `kubectl logs` works.
+              value: "192.168.0.0/16"
+            # Disable file logging so 'kubectl logs' works.
             - name: CALICO_DISABLE_FILE_LOGGING
               value: "true"
             # Set Felix endpoint to host default action to ACCEPT.
@@ -453,7 +441,7 @@ spec:
         # This container installs the Calico CNI binaries
         # and CNI network config file on each node.
         - name: install-cni
-          image: ${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-docker.io/calico/}cni:v3.3.6
+          image: calico/cni:v3.3.6
           command: ["/install-cni.sh"]
           env:
             # Name of the CNI config file to create.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-12 12:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

http://paste.openstack.org/raw/749238/'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FYI, a quick test for sonobuoy is:
sonobuoy run --e2e-focus "should provide DNS for the cluster"

if this passes usually the other will pass too. You don't have to wait for one hour for it to finish/timeout. When you are sure you can run the full test.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-12 14:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-18 10:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

out diff from upstream:

commit bddeb993190d89ded73935664d257772d79b92de
Author: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>
Date:   Thu Apr 18 12:31:20 2019 +0200

    Diff from upstream
    
    Change-Id: I656d11b2285d7f822a4f87e54a0a445b22f0b820

diff --git a/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/calico-service.sh b/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/calico-service.sh
index 3a34564..0862d03 100644
--- a/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/calico-service.sh
+++ b/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/calico-service.sh
@@ -232,7 +232,7 @@ spec:
       # as a host-networked pod.
       serviceAccountName: calico-node
       containers:
-      - image: calico/typha:v3.3.6
+      - image: "${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-docker.io/calico/}typha:${CALICO_TAG}"
         name: calico-typha
         ports:
         - containerPort: 5473
@@ -346,7 +346,7 @@ spec:
         # container programs network policy and routes on each
         # host.
         - name: calico-node
-          image: calico/node:v3.3.6
+          image: "${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-docker.io/calico/}node:${CALICO_TAG}"
           env:
             # Use Kubernetes API as the backing datastore.
             - name: DATASTORE_TYPE
@@ -377,21 +377,21 @@ spec:
             # Auto-detect the BGP IP address.
             - name: IP
               value: "autodetect"
-            # Enable IPIP
-            - name: CALICO_IPV4POOL_IPIP
-              value: "Always"
-            # Set MTU for tunnel device used if ipip is enabled
-            - name: FELIX_IPINIPMTU
-              valueFrom:
-                configMapKeyRef:
-                  name: calico-config
-                  key: veth_mtu
             # The default IPv4 pool to create on startup if none exists. Pod IPs will be
             # chosen from this range. Changing this value after installation will have
-            # no effect. This should fall within `--cluster-cidr`.
+            # no effect. This should fall within '--cluster-cidr'.
             - name: CALICO_IPV4POOL_CIDR
-              value: "192.168.0.0/16"
-            # Disable file logging so `kubectl logs` works.
+              value: ${CALICO_IPV4POOL}
+            - name: CALICO_IPV4POOL_IPIP
+              value: "off"
+            - name: CALICO_IPV4POOL_NAT_OUTGOING
+              value: "true"
+            # Set noderef for node controller.
+            - name: CALICO_K8S_NODE_REF
+              valueFrom:
+                fieldRef:
+                  fieldPath: spec.nodeName
+            # Disable file logging so 'kubectl logs' works.
             - name: CALICO_DISABLE_FILE_LOGGING
               value: "true"
             # Set Felix endpoint to host default action to ACCEPT.
@@ -441,7 +441,7 @@ spec:
         # This container installs the Calico CNI binaries
         # and CNI network config file on each node.
         - name: install-cni
-          image: calico/cni:v3.3.6
+          image: "${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-docker.io/calico/}cni:${CALICO_TAG}"
           command: ["/install-cni.sh"]
           env:
             # Name of the CNI config file to create.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-18 11:01:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-18 11:10:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-18 11:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-18 11:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
[fedora-atomic][k8s] Support default Keystone auth policy file

With the new config option `keystone_auth_default_policy`, cloud admin
can set a default keystone auth policy for k8s cluster when the
keystone auth is enabled. As a result, user can use their current
keystone user to access k8s cluster as long as they're assigned
correct roles, and they will get the pre-defined permissions
set by the cloud provider.

The default policy now is based on the v2 format recently introduced
in k8s-keystone-auth which is getting more useful now. For example,
in v1 it doesn't support a policy for user to access resources from
all namespaces but kube-system, but v2 can do that.

NOTE: Now we're using openstackmagnum dockerhub repo until CPO
team fixing their image release issue.

Task: 30069
Story: 1755770

Change-Id: I2425e957bd99edc92482b6f11ca0b1f91fe59ff6

commit_message:
Use OS_CACERT for zaqar's websocket connection

The CA certificatge was hardcoded. This was not the right thing to do,
since we do have the ability to provide our own cert for TripleO.

python-openstackclient already has a way for us to know what certificate
was used. This is provided via the OS_CACERT environment variable (or
the --os-cacert command line argument). So we use this instead.

Change-Id: Ib7b3860378fce2cda7f80c1ad8b8dd14a4b22581
Closes-Bug: #1817634
(cherry picked from commit 24ac1f137c7bf03b4e6310d65344374695498d89)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-28 20:36:27.000000000', 'message': 'utils/config: generate param_config.json if param_config exists

In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661093, we are preparing a new
interface "param_config" which exposes the parameters structure used by
the configuration tools.

To use this data, we want to write it on the host so it can be consummed
later by the configuration management tools (e.g. Hiera or Ansible
later?).
The file will be generated next to step_config.pp and will mostly be
useful when running Puppet on baremetal hosts for now:
A new hieradata file will be created in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661093
called param_config.json, which will be at the top level hierarchy.
The "param_config" parameter will have a deep merge behavior so hiera
data files like extraconfig, etc, will be able to override this
configuration.

When Puppet is run _from_ the containers, the container-puppet.py will
read the same data directly from the puppet_config for each service (if
it does exist).

Change-Id: I8127203b82e503fb9d6013b47fdd3066aee1b474
'}, {'created': '2019-05-30 14:14:24.000000000', 'message': 'utils/config: generate param_config.json if param_config exists

In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661093, we are preparing a new
interface "param_config" which exposes the parameters structure used by
the configuration tools.

To use this data, we want to write it on the host so it can be consummed
later by the configuration management tools (e.g. Hiera or Ansible
later?).
The file will be generated next to step_config.pp and will mostly be
useful when running Puppet on baremetal hosts for now:
A new hieradata file will be created in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661093
called param_config.json, which will be at the top level hierarchy.
The "param_config" parameter will have a deep merge behavior so hiera
data files like extraconfig, etc, will be able to override this
configuration.

When Puppet is run _from_ the containers, the container-puppet.py will
read the same data directly from the puppet_config for each service (if
it does exist).

Change-Id: I8127203b82e503fb9d6013b47fdd3066aee1b474
'}]
commit_message:
utils/config: generate param_config.json if param_config exists

In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661093, we are preparing a new
interface "param_config" which exposes the parameters structure used by
the configuration tools.

To use this data, we want to write it on the host so it can be consummed
later by the configuration management tools (e.g. Hiera or Ansible
later?).
The file will be generated next to step_config.pp and will mostly be
useful when running Puppet on baremetal hosts for now:
A new hieradata file will be created in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661093
called param_config.json, which will be at the top level hierarchy.
The "param_config" parameter will have a deep merge behavior so hiera
data files like extraconfig, etc, will be able to override this
configuration.

When Puppet is run _from_ the containers, the container-puppet.py will
read the same data directly from the puppet_config for each service (if
it does exist).

Change-Id: I8127203b82e503fb9d6013b47fdd3066aee1b474

commit_message:
Fix undefined variable python_interpreter

In a backport, an undefined variable was accidentally introduced.
This patch corrects this by removing that variable.

The review that introduced this was 
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661105

Related-Bug: 1830235
Change-Id: Ife925c7d659592364b98ff05aded515bc9461351

messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-29 17:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-05-30 02:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-06-01 07:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30381, 'date': '2019-06-02 22:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-06-11 09:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-29 17:08:51.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Stop running watcherclient-tempest-functional

The watcherclient-tempest-functional job is broken for stable
branches since python-watcherclient in stable/stein does not
support microversions but that is what the tempest plugin
is using when executing commands [1]. Since the job is non-voting
in stable anyway we are not losing anything really, and fixing
the job in stable would be complicated, so we just remove it here.

[1] I79fcaded18471d2df4d49a526ad3024e55488f96

Change-Id: Idff3f7cb3db1af1aacb680ab3611149355474841
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Stop running watcherclient-tempest-functional

The watcherclient-tempest-functional job is broken for stable
branches since python-watcherclient in stable/stein does not
support microversions but that is what the tempest plugin
is using when executing commands [1]. Since the job is non-voting
in stable anyway we are not losing anything really, and fixing
the job in stable would be complicated, so we just remove it here.

[1] I79fcaded18471d2df4d49a526ad3024e55488f96

Change-Id: Idff3f7cb3db1af1aacb680ab3611149355474841

[{'created': '2019-06-10 17:33:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update LXC container config options

OpenSUSE Leap 15.0 now ships with lxc 3.1 which changed two config
options:

1. lxc.kmsg was removed
2. lxc.pts was renamed to lxc.pty.max

This change updates these two options in the container config.

Change-Id: I7b4c657e9216b5e3926672b76cb370256b98ce3c
Depends-On: I8a94f340b8866f3369cebb5950dea873f5d2fece
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-06-10 17:47:14.000000000', 'message': 'Update LXC container config options

We use the repository `OBS:Virtualization:containers` to install lxc
on OpenSUSE Leap 42.3. This repository now ships with lxc 3.1 which
changed two config options:

1. lxc.kmsg was removed
2. lxc.pts was renamed to lxc.pty.max

This change updates these two options in the container config.

Change-Id: I7b4c657e9216b5e3926672b76cb370256b98ce3c
Depends-On: I8a94f340b8866f3369cebb5950dea873f5d2fece
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-06-10 21:35:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update LXC container config options

The openSUSE repository Virtualization:Containers/lxc now ships with lxc 3.1
for Leap 42.3 which changed two config options:

1. lxc.kmsg was removed
2. lxc.pts was renamed to lxc.pty.max

This change updates these two options in the container config.

Change-Id: I7b4c657e9216b5e3926672b76cb370256b98ce3c
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update LXC container config options

The openSUSE repository Virtualization:Containers/lxc now ships with lxc 3.1
for Leap 42.3 which changed two config options:

1. lxc.kmsg was removed
2. lxc.pts was renamed to lxc.pty.max

This change updates these two options in the container config.

Change-Id: I7b4c657e9216b5e3926672b76cb370256b98ce3c
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 09:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for using Falcon 2.0.0

Falcon 2.0.0 introduces some breaking changes. The relevant ones here
are: - falcon.testing.TestCase.api property was removed -
falcon.testing.TestBase class was removed Additionally, the default
behaviour for handling trailing slashes on URIs also changed:

commit_message:
Add support for using Falcon 2.0.0

Falcon 2.0.0 introduces some breaking changes. The relevant ones here are:

- falcon.testing.TestCase.api property was removed
- falcon.testing.TestBase class was removed
- falcon.HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge exception was renamed to
 falcon.HTTPPayloadTooLarge

Additionally, the default behaviour for handling trailing slashes on
URIs also changed:

https://falcon.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user/faq.html#how-does-falcon-
handle-a-trailing-slash-in-the-request-path

This commit adds support for using the new release.

Story: 2005695
Task: 33474

Change-Id: I2379522efef81b919098a0143b66cc259a184e70

In general I like this change, because it fixes https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py#L284-L286 But I believe it can be optimized a little.
The main concern is that we will store all next task names in the database after that. If we have just one next task with a short name, it's absolutely okay, but there can be a lot of them, and the whole performance will be degraded in that case.
Funny thing that it can be avoided - in many cases we already know a list of next task, based on the task specification and its execution status. So, if in a task spec we have

on-success:

  - "a"

  - "b"
  
and we know that task has finished successfully, next tasks are "a" and "b", right? Then what's the point of storing next task names in the database?

But there is one case where it is useful - task transitions with conditions. In this case we have to reevaluate task context and it can be very resource consuming.

So, my suggestion for the improvement - store only next task names with conditional transitions, and implement a function that will calculate next tasks based on task execution's state, next_conditional_tasks list from the db and the spec. It should be much faster.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-06-10 10:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2019-06-10 10:37:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-06-10 10:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

yes, I know. Awkward rebase, sorry.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-06-10 10:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-06-10 10:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> In general I like this change, because it fixes https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py#L284-L286
 > But I believe it can be optimized a little.
 > The main concern is that we will store all next task names in the
 > database after that. If we have just one next task with a short
 > name, it's absolutely okay, but there can be a lot of them, and the
 > whole performance will be degraded in that case.
 > Funny thing that it can be avoided - in many cases we already know

 > next_conditional_tasks list from the db and the spec. It should be
 > much faster.

Yes. Let me test this idea first on whether it's going to work in other places like pause/resume. We can make it with a separate patch.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2019-06-10 11:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2019-06-10 14:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7700, 'date': '2019-06-10 15:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2019-06-10 18:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Store next task names in DB

* In many places Mistral has to calculate next task names of the
  given task execution. It may be expensive in case of large graphs
  and/or large expressions. Instead of evaluating next tasks again
  and again we can evaluate next task names just once when a task
  completes (it happens already anyway) and store them in DB. They
  can be reused later whenever it's needed.
* Style changes
* Removed a large amount of unused variables in
  test_subworkflows_pause_resume.

Change-Id: Ib3a684f63f05a7cfe846782774d2c68be78bebab

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 08:22:14.000000000', 'message': "Limit max search depth

Now, to find an induced join state for a task we prepare a set of
all task's parent names and then perform a db request to fetch all
the tasks in one request.

But sometimes the depth of the search can be great, and even searching
of parent task names can be time-consuming.
To prevent this situation this patch introduces limited depth search,
Which finds parent tasks at a limited depth first, and loads the rest
only if necessary.

Change-Id: I7126b7c9652f190ec5c8423fad60d18729840a3a

Change-Id: I7126b7c9652f190ec5c8423fad60d18729840a3a
"}]
commit_message:
Limit max search depth

Now, to find an induced join state for a task we prepare a set of
all task's parent names and then perform a db request to fetch all
the tasks in one request.

But sometimes the depth of the search can be great, and even searching
of parent task names can be time-consuming.
To prevent this situation this patch introduces limited depth search,
Which finds parent tasks at a limited depth first, and loads the rest
only if necessary.

Change-Id: I7126b7c9652f190ec5c8423fad60d18729840a3a

commit_message:
Configure Neutron API for Nova Placement...

...to store Keystone authentication credentials. When the
Neutron Routed Provider Networks feature is used in the
overcloud, the Networking service will use those credentials
to communicate with the Compute scheduler's placement API.

See for details:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-routed-networks.html#example-configuration

Conflicts:
    puppet/services/neutron-api.yaml

Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1831745
Related-blueprint: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment
Change-Id: I60e4fe26a67be2c5f74b605d076efdaddcbce5ca

messages:
[{'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-02 12:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-03 08:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19184, 'date': '2019-06-03 08:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-03 10:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19184, 'date': '2019-06-03 11:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-03 13:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-04 07:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-04 08:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-06-04 09:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

IMO, this feature should not be added to the client. I do understand the use case but such kind of automation should be done outside the client by some third party software/scripts. 

The client supposed to be the thin wrapper around the API and it would be really good to have the feature parity between Python and CLI interfaces.

I'm putting -2 for now, to get more attention from the community. If the team decides to go forward this way, I'll change my vote to -1 to not block the patch"}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-04 09:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

What I did was implement a new API called upsert (merge) which is a known feature in databases (https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/upsert)

I could have used a new API instead of using a flag on CLI

This is something we use all the time especially on upgrades'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-06-04 11:55:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> What I did was implement a new API called upsert (merge) which is a
 > known feature in databases (https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/upsert)
 > 
 > I could have used a new API instead of using a flag on CLI
 > 
 > This is something we use all the time especially on upgrades

I think that from a user perspective, you would expect an overwrite functionality in Vitrage. Theoretically, we would like to have a smart template update that compares the templates and performs only the needed changes, but this is too complex. 

Regarding the right place for this code - I'm fine with the CLI, but maybe moving it to the backend would be better. We can have an hard-coded wait (without a flag) after the old template deletion, because this is a must for correct behaviour of the evaluator. Then, after calling template add, the API can return while the template is still in status LOADING, just like regular add."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I still prefer to have this implemented as update API on the backend side. The current approach has race condition and could lead to some errors if somebody has automation tools based on the template ID'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-06-11 09:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Add option to overwrite when adding template

Add --overwrite to the cli as an option
in this case the template will be deleted before adding
if already exists

Change-Id: Ia22df7d4414553c3e897d2df049bed8cb9f3438c

messages:

This patch is not needed anymore, as Sphinx 2.1.1 was released, in which the patch causing the error was reverted.

(See: https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/6447#issuecomment-500416221 )'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 16:29:05.000000000', 'message': "Exclude constants from autodoc

Since the 2.1.0 release of Sphinx, the docs fail to build because of
the warnings-treated-as-errors of the now autodoc'd imported external
modules[1]. This change configures sphinx-autodoc to ignore those
constants so that the docs can build and the documentation from the
external modules isn't included in oslo.utils's.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/6447

Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
Change-Id: Ie7db0f7b96b9f6f6bbfa9e76b707bf5b079e722f
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude constants from autodoc

Since the 2.1.0 release of Sphinx, the docs fail to build because of
the warnings-treated-as-errors of the now autodoc'd imported external
modules[1]. This change configures sphinx-autodoc to ignore those
constants so that the docs can build and the documentation from the
external modules isn't included in oslo.utils's.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/6447

Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
Change-Id: Ie7db0f7b96b9f6f6bbfa9e76b707bf5b079e722f

messages:
[{'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-05-28 11:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-05-28 12:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It should be done in DIB.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-05-28 12:33:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-05-28 17:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-05-29 09:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-05-29 11:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-05-29 11:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-05-29 22:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Backport-Candidate-1

(1 comment)

This still seems fundamentally wrong that we should have to change anything here. It seems like this should be fixed inside DIB as it breaks the contract with the elements.
Can we get a write up, likely in a story, that describes why this is necessary and references diskimage-builder bugs or code sections?'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-05-30 08:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This still seems fundamentally wrong that we should have to change
 > anything here. It seems like this should be fixed inside DIB as it
 > breaks the contract with the elements.
 > Can we get a write up, likely in a story, that describes why this
 > is necessary and references diskimage-builder bugs or code
 > sections?

Thanks for the feedback, Michael.

Could you please elaborate about why is it breaking the contract with the elements?

When I tried to figure out how to the distro name in diskimage-builder (for the case mentioned in the commit msg), I looked[1] at how other OpenStack projects interact with diskimage-builder. It does show they set both DISTRO_NAME and DIB_RELEASE (e.g. openstack-ansible-ops, sahara-image-elements).

For that reason, started to get the impression that we do the same (for DISTRO_NAME) just with a different variable name.

Additionally, this[3] document does mention the fact that $DISTRO_NAME should be exported, so that might explain some things.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=DISTRO_NAME&i=nope&files=&repos=
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/latest/developer/developing_elements.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/latest/developer/developing_elements.html#operating-system-elements'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-05-30 08:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > This still seems fundamentally wrong that we should have to
 > change
 > > anything here. It seems like this should be fixed inside DIB as
 > it
 > > breaks the contract with the elements.
 > > Can we get a write up, likely in a story, that describes why this
 > > is necessary and references diskimage-builder bugs or code
 > > sections?
 > 
 > Thanks for the feedback, Michael.
 >

When diskimage-builder gets invoked by diskimage-create.sh, $DIB_RELEASE is
set whereas $DISTRO_NAME is not.

This[1] change to diskimage-builder adds support for RHEL8 and also changes
the default file-system specifically for it to 'xfs', which means that

which is used exclusively[3] in  Octavia diskimage-create.sh, is.

This patch replaces $AMP_BASEOS with $DISTRO_NAME, which is a variable name
used in diskimage-builder[4].

commit_message:
Replace AMP_BASEOS with DISTRO_NAME for diskimage-builder RHEL8 img-defaults

When diskimage-builder gets invoked by diskimage-create.sh, $DIB_RELEASE
is set whereas $DISTRO_NAME is not.

This[1] change to diskimage-builder adds support for RHEL8 and also
changes the default file-system specifically for it to 'xfs', which
means that diskimage-builder needs to be aware of the DISTRO_NAME before
it gets to load the specific elements provided to it.

The above makes it difficult to leverage img-defaults[2], the
environment variable $DISTRO_NAME is not set when img-defaults is called
but $AMP_BASEOS, which is used exclusively[3] in Octavia
diskimage-create.sh, is.

This patch replaces $AMP_BASEOS with $DISTRO_NAME, which is a variable
name used in diskimage-builder[4].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/643731/
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/src/branch/master/diskimage_builder/lib/img-defaults
[3] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=AMP_BASEOS&i=nope&files=&repos=
[4] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=DISTRO_NAME&i=nope&files=&repos=

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643731/
Change-Id: Id7543ae82703386fcd0f98428c340be4570b0b2f

commit_message:
Add parameter for `scheduler/query_placement_for_image_type_support`

Add paramerer `query_placement_for_image_type_support` that controls
whether to add ask placement only for compute hosts that support the
``disk_format`` of the image used in the request.

Change-Id: I6d895a4789f44380565e3d2e3461d0bbb501c86b

[{'created': '2019-06-05 10:15:30.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit b7796f6c91b74440780056712060da5da69e583f.
and commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6.

Change-Id: Icf253a2d969828f3bd3c629c3765e15e9769be28
Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit b7796f6c91b74440780056712060da5da69e583f.
and commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6.

Change-Id: Icf253a2d969828f3bd3c629c3765e15e9769be28
Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-10 13:41:45.000000000', 'message': 'Enable isolated provider network metadata access

When an isolated provider network with no virtual routers metadata
access occurs in the qdhcp netns.

Without the force_metadata option in dhcp_agent.ini and the haproxy
package installed ns-metadata-proxy is not enabled. ns-metdata-proxy
sits in the ip netns and proxies requests from 169.254.169.254 to the
nova-api-metadata service outside the netns.

This change adds the force_metadata option and installs haproxy when
enable-local-dhcp-and-metadata is True.

Closes-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iaad1501e8d7d58888ef0917b6700d22a7cf05ecf
(cherry picked from commit a1639fe51f48b9a6cdb5185c5bffc4480f4e264b)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable isolated provider network metadata access

When an isolated provider network with no virtual routers metadata
access occurs in the qdhcp netns.

Without the force_metadata option in dhcp_agent.ini and the haproxy
package installed ns-metadata-proxy is not enabled. ns-metdata-proxy
sits in the ip netns and proxies requests from 169.254.169.254 to the
nova-api-metadata service outside the netns.

This change adds the force_metadata option and installs haproxy when
enable-local-dhcp-and-metadata is True.

Closes-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iaad1501e8d7d58888ef0917b6700d22a7cf05ecf
(cherry picked from commit a1639fe51f48b9a6cdb5185c5bffc4480f4e264b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 19:03:41.000000000', 'message': 'rbac: Catch correct exception for duplicated entry

RBAC network policy is uniquely identified by network ID. That means
when attempting to create such network policy, we should not retry when
such policy already exists in the database.

Before we switched in rbac to use OVO, we translated DB DBDuplicateEntry
on such ocasions into dedicated RBAC exception to avoid DB retry
mechanism (see bug/1551473). After introducing OVO layer for RBAC, the
exception was not changed to the one coming from OVO. This patch
replaces the exception from DB to the exception from OVO.

Another patch will go to neutron-tempest-plugin to limit time API needs
to reply with failure to user, when attempting to create an existing
policy.

Closes bug: #1831647

Change-Id: I7c65376f6fd6fc29d510ea532a684917ed95deb1
'}, {'created': '2019-06-06 19:23:19.000000000', 'message': 'rbac: Catch correct exception for duplicated entry

RBAC network policy is uniquely identified by network ID. That means
when attempting to create such network policy, we should not retry when
such policy already exists in the database.

Before we switched in rbac to use OVO, we translated DB DBDuplicateEntry
on such ocasions into dedicated RBAC exception to avoid DB retry
mechanism (see bug/1551473). After introducing OVO layer for RBAC, the
exception was not changed to the one coming from OVO. This patch
replaces the exception from DB to the exception from OVO.

Another patch will go to neutron-tempest-plugin to limit time API needs
to reply with failure to user, when attempting to create an existing
policy.

Closes-Bug: #1831647

Change-Id: I7c65376f6fd6fc29d510ea532a684917ed95deb1
'}]
commit_message:
rbac: Catch correct exception for duplicated entry

RBAC network policy is uniquely identified by network ID. That means
when attempting to create such network policy, we should not retry when
such policy already exists in the database.

Before we switched in rbac to use OVO, we translated DB DBDuplicateEntry
on such ocasions into dedicated RBAC exception to avoid DB retry
mechanism (see bug/1551473). After introducing OVO layer for RBAC, the
exception was not changed to the one coming from OVO. This patch
replaces the exception from DB to the exception from OVO.

Another patch will go to neutron-tempest-plugin to limit time API needs
to reply with failure to user, when attempting to create an existing
policy.

Closes-Bug: #1831647

Change-Id: I7c65376f6fd6fc29d510ea532a684917ed95deb1

commit_message:
List requests as explicit dependency

this package is directly imported and used in vault_key_manager.py
but is missing from requirements relying on implicit dependency
via keystoneauth package instead.

Projects should explicitly list their imported dependencies.

Change-Id: I59c87fa7264cbace651d86430785925307d1978d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 16:03:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix cookiecutter tox tests in gate

It looks like for some reason the script is getting a relative path
in ci, which does not work because we do a find on that path at the
end of the script. This is problematic because at that point we've
already cd'd into a different directory so the relative path is no
longer valid.

To fix this, the find is changed to just look at the current
directory, which is the path we wanted to look at anyway.

Change-Id: I13f046d0df2491d3bba04c3feb0fbac7cd188d3c
"}, {'created': '2019-05-31 17:19:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix cookiecutter tox tests in gate

It looks like for some reason the script is getting a relative path
in ci, which does not work because we do a find on that path at the
end of the script. This is problematic because at that point we've
already cd'd into a different directory so the relative path is no
longer valid.

To fix this, the find is changed to just look at the current
directory, which is the path we wanted to look at anyway.

Change-Id: I13f046d0df2491d3bba04c3feb0fbac7cd188d3c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cookiecutter tox tests in gate

It looks like for some reason the script is getting a relative path
in ci, which does not work because we do a find on that path at the
end of the script. This is problematic because at that point we've
already cd'd into a different directory so the relative path is no
longer valid.

To fix this, the find is changed to just look at the current
directory, which is the path we wanted to look at anyway.

Change-Id: I13f046d0df2491d3bba04c3feb0fbac7cd188d3c

[{'created': '2019-05-21 09:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Per-Role NodeExtraConfigPost

We have {{role.name}}ExtraConfigPost already, but this
resource is always of type: OS::TripleO::NodeExtraConfigPost.
Add resource OS::TripleO::{{role.name}}::NodeExtraConfigPost
(defaulting to OS::TripleO::NodeExtraConfigPost) so that
users can use per-role NodeExtraConfigPost.

'}]
commit_message:
Per-Role NodeExtraConfigPost

We have {{role.name}}ExtraConfigPost already, but this
resource is always of type: OS::TripleO::NodeExtraConfigPost.
Add resource OS::TripleO::{{role.name}}::NodeExtraConfigPost
(defaulting to OS::TripleO::NodeExtraConfigPost) so that
users can use per-role NodeExtraConfigPost.

Change-Id: I992f58ddb4898233445611dcdcc734412e3498d5

Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I676fdc12fe0bb1278754d6f21c6a113b4182186f
Closes-Bug: #1831406

commit_message:
Adds `Name` field to `System` resource response

Before this, the system `Name` field was not being populated in the
json response being sent on querying a specific `System` resource.
This patch populates the said `Name` field.

Change-Id: I1fc039de074b4ce41753c13cca9b6ebbca0b23fa

commit_message:
Make sure we pass the proper new pcs 0.10 variables

With I852d5d7aa8578c45f0c7215827cedd4ea72c8d0b we will now
use the new system to create pacemaker remotes when pcs 0.10
is installed on the system (RHEL/Centos >=8). This new
way of doing things requires the remotes to set up pcsd
and so we need to pass the same pcs user and password that
are used by pacemaker itself to the remote resource.

Tested on an IHA OSP15 deployment and got a successful deployment.

Depends-On: I852d5d7aa8578c45f0c7215827cedd4ea72c8d0b
Change-Id: I02a8c1d618b11f68f9272b9044ff81ac39d6a81b

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ctlplane-ip-range validations

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section. Morever, the `undercloud_conf` custom plugin has some
issues to generate facts coming from the 'undercloud.conf' file due to the new
section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's values
from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom
plugin.

Resolves: rhbz#1660075

Change-Id: I7689e1c8f7f44058b0ad44318c5eef522ddfad52
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Write out overcloud_baremetal_deploy.yaml

This file will be consumed by the command "openstack overcloud node
provision".

In quickstart it is built by merging the topology map with the
baremetal node names discovered from instackenv.json so that each
overcloud node is assigned a baremetal node.

This approach may evolve over time for cases where baremetal nodes are
not identically specced.

This file will only be used when undercloud_enable_nova is false.

Change-Id: Icb6797b7ca4a2a071b0f30b5b7e468ae8b8d1a3d
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

This is causing a problem with buildah/podman when they consume the
populated /etc/containers/registries.conf. When deployed with docker
the original behaviour is maintained.

Change-Id: I1f2f2690330af1f7b143c01affe088f954df8d7c
Closes-Bug: #1831152
(cherry picked from commit b44d6f84ed288281b628e75bc2ae8f952f2055d4)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop the port from DockerInsecureRegistryAddress

This is causing a problem with buildah/podman when they consume the
populated /etc/containers/registries.conf. When deployed with docker
the original behaviour is maintained.

Change-Id: I1f2f2690330af1f7b143c01affe088f954df8d7c
Closes-Bug: #1831152
(cherry picked from commit b44d6f84ed288281b628e75bc2ae8f952f2055d4)

commit_message:
Add general LOG in kolla_builder.py.

This commit includes a global level log to be accessible
from the auxiliary functions as well as the defined
classes.
At the same time, it adds some log to identify when there
was not ContainerImagePrepare parameter passed.

Change-Id: Ibaddff1239f1cf4b590c86b41306ca1977d6eb6e

commit_message:
Only request certs in step 1

The certmonger-user service used to run in every step. This limits it to
only step 1.

(cherry picked from commit 98e9879fd55194ed86c294158cabbf21ec1c903f)
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I119fa1da61f2385c672391beb4071f0ac2731f21

[{'created': '2019-06-07 09:40:07.000000000', 'message': "Sync 'validations/rabbitmq-limits.yaml' with the new role

To be able to maintain stable branches, the validations in the 'validations'
directory have to be synchronized with the new role created with the

commit_message:
Sync 'validations/rabbitmq-limits.yaml' with the new role

To be able to maintain stable branches, the validations in the 'validations'
directory have to be synchronized with the new role created with the
validation framework.

This patch synchronizes the rabbitmq-limits validation.

Change-Id: I21952cbc8788fba07fdb30cf6c0f130de1d1f966
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-09 11:40:48.000000000', 'message': "Implement FTP Backup Storage Strategy

Implements ftp server as storage for backups.

So far only Swift storage could be used as storage for backups.
The goal of this changeset is to add alternative storage.

As FTP server doesnt support any similar feature like Swift's
Static Large Object, we have to do following steps manually:
    * callculating checksums for all segment files
    * concatenating segments when they are fetched
    from ftp

Creting and restoring backup is perfofmed in place, without exhausting
disk or memory resources (with exception to restoring backup,
this needs 2GB on disk - backup_segment_max_size default vlaue).

In order to change strategy, configuration needs
to be updated with following parameters:

    storage_strategy = FtpStorage
    storage_namespace = trove.common.strategies.storage.ftp

FTP storage is disabled by default and needs to be turned on to be
used.

Co-Authored-By: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I3c95b0d95da65d825b3895e5997be704360b5e38
Signed-off-by: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-05-10 11:27:29.000000000', 'message': "Implement FTP Backup Storage Strategy

Implements ftp server as storage for backups.

So far only Swift storage could be used as storage for backups. The
goal of this changeset is to add alternative storage.

As FTP server doesnt support any similar feature like Swift's Static
Large Object, we have to do following steps manually:
    * callculating checksums for all segment files

Creting and restoring backup is perfofmed in place, without exhausting
disk or memory resources (with exception to restoring backup, this
needs 2GB on disk - backup_segment_max_size default vlaue).

In order to change strategy, configuration needs to be updated with
following parameters:

    storage_strategy = FtpStorage
    storage_namespace = trove.common.strategies.storage.experimental.ftp

Note that this configuration needs to be applied for trove, guestagent
and taskmanager config files.

FTP storage is an optional strategy - the default option is Swift. The
corresponding FTP server must work in passive mode.

commit_message:
Implement FTP Backup Storage Strategy

Implements ftp server as storage for backups.

So far only Swift storage could be used as storage for backups. The
goal of this changeset is to add alternative storage.

As FTP server doesnt support any similar feature like Swift's Static
Large Object, we have to do following steps manually:
    * callculating checksums for all segment files
    * concatenating segments when they are fetched from ftp

Creting and restoring backup is perfofmed in place, without exhausting
disk or memory resources (with exception to restoring backup, this
needs 2GB on disk - backup_segment_max_size default vlaue).

In order to change strategy, configuration needs to be updated with
following parameters:

    storage_strategy = FtpStorage
    storage_namespace = trove.common.strategies.storage.experimental.ftp

Note that this configuration needs to be applied for trove, guestagent
and taskmanager config files.

FTP storage is an optional strategy - the default option is Swift. The
corresponding FTP server must work in passive mode.

Story: #2005595
Task: #30799
Co-Authored-By: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I3c95b0d95da65d825b3895e5997be704360b5e38
Signed-off-by: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Kubernetes 'ssl_ca_cert' value error

When tacker registers kubernetes vim using Kubernetes config file,
ssl_ca_cert value doesn't accept all of none value such as none, NONE..etc. So, it makes errors.

Closes-Bug: #1829384

Change-Id: I1aa2c4c489a3196fa8f88c1ca8420e8b344d875b

commit_message:
Publish StoryBoard releases to PyPI

Per the most recent meeting[*] the StoryBoard maintainers have
resolved to start publishing releases to PyPI with some regularity.
Add the corresponding job template.

[*] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/storyboard/2019/storyboard.2019-06-05-19.03.html

Change-Id: I6e646a65a2c93ec80332c248fa892bae66951146
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/661663

> Duplicate of Icbb0b341be19f87bd23064a2b4f98e68bf492a25?

Indeed, looks like a duplicate. But this change looks better, it's handling both fsid we use that come from ceph and it's making the change only to rbd_utils.py where it's needed.

This patch does need a bit of unit test coverage though."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-06-06 18:32:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@leeyarwood yes indeed i hadn't spotted that other patch, probably because they forgot to add Closes-Bug so it didn't show up in the LP. This patch is defo based of the other cinder path though. I'm happy to add unit tests to this patch if we want to use this one or switch to other. Will get that done tomrrow."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-06-06 18:52:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

as an aside, i just tested this patch in a local deployment and it isnt actually sufficient to resolve the problem because the value stored by glance is also invalid - https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/mj9gFpSBMv/

i'll have a look see if i can get the glance value stripped of invalid characters when doing the comparison but otherwise ill have to patch glance as well."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-06-07 08:17:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility of rbd get_fsid

In py3 librados's get_fsid() function returns a binary string
which breaks comparison when compared with the same value as a
string. This is currently breakin the logic that compares ceph
cluster fsids when deciding whether the image used to boot an
instance is cow-clonable.

Change-Id: I79b40ca40400c67b0805926096317afd875ffabb
Closes-Bug: #1816468

commit_message:
Remove the DRBDManage Driver

The DRBDManage driver was marked unsupported in
the Stein release.  It is replaced by the new
LINSTOR driver.

Change-Id: Idf236113f6354db71b6651c7b55ab4189271412a
