commit_message:
Make OVS controller inactivity_probe configurable

This parameter applies to the OVSDB Controller table when the
native openflow driver is used. There are reports that increasing
it can reduce errors on busy systems. This patch also sets the
default value to 10s which is more than the OVS default of 5s.
See the ovs-vswitchd.conf.db man page for full description.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py
    neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: If0d42919412dac75deb4d7f484c42cea630fbc59
Partial-Bug: #1817022
(cherry picked from commit 540d00f68ecf1c11b0296922f965ef60d15d1a86)

(cherry picked from commit eaad77758daeefb69bd60d48b8ca1e2814604f8a)
(cherry picked from commit 7891c7cd05ad5cff12b1f386cd116db408708371)

commit_message:
Read description file as utf-8

Currently pbr fails if the description file contains unicode
characters.  To fix this we need to open the description file as
utf-8 explicitly.  Since open() in Python 2 doesn't support an
encoding parameter, use io.open() which works on both 2 and 3.

Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud<hberaud@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1bee502ac84b474cc9db5523d2437a8c0a861c00
Closes-Bug: 1704472

subject: Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition
messages: [{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-06-05 13:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-06-06 06:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-06 15:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-06-07 16:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-06-10 20:14:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 13:02:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, commits may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d84cb7938a153bd22a6fae5adbfbf8ec3b819bda)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, commits may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d84cb7938a153bd22a6fae5adbfbf8ec3b819bda)

commit_message:
Cleanup debian cinder service distro package list

The debian packages for individual cinder services provide service
configs which automatically start after install, leading to all cinder
services running on each cinder volume host. Instead only install the
python3-cinder library package and rely on the service files OSA manages.

uwsgi packages are only required on hosts running cinder-api, so an
additional variable, 'cinder_api_distro_packages' has been added for
packages specific to those hosts.

Beginning in the Stein release, Ubuntu distro packages are now using
Python3. This requires additionally installing and using the uwsgi
python3 plugin.

Change-Id: Iafcd9a8141fffb2226ec5103960064decc579bd5

commit_message:
Add Debian placement_service_distro_packages list

Add the list of distro packages to install for distro based installs on
debian/ubuntu systems and ensure that the python3 plugin is used by uwsgi.

Also set the 'placement_uwsgi_bin' var for each OS distribution.

Change-Id: I6cb2093b3577392c1fd7e3769a4b7cb27c18e0a7

The extra variables are meant to be loaded contextually if ansible
or ansible-playbook are executed in the OSA playbooks dir, or if the
openstack-ansible wrapper is explicitly called.

This is occurring correctly for openstack-ansible and ansible-playbook,
but extra vars are not being loaded correctly (despite being output
to console as if they're being loaded) when ad-hoc ansible commands
are run in the OSA context.

Change-Id: I023871df159413f9313d7a85820a50872da2b36b
(cherry picked from commit cb26d9a3fd6eb8265d60ae10cdef649f95ddeaa3)
"}]
commit_message:
Load extra variables correctly in wrapper

The extra variables are meant to be loaded contextually if ansible
or ansible-playbook are executed in the OSA playbooks dir, or if the
openstack-ansible wrapper is explicitly called.

This is occurring correctly for openstack-ansible and ansible-playbook,
but extra vars are not being loaded correctly (despite being output
to console as if they're being loaded) when ad-hoc ansible commands
are run in the OSA context.

Change-Id: I023871df159413f9313d7a85820a50872da2b36b
(cherry picked from commit cb26d9a3fd6eb8265d60ae10cdef649f95ddeaa3)

commit_message:
Cleanup debian nova service distro package list

The debian packages for individual nova services provide service
configs which automatically start after install, leading to all nova
services running on each compute host. Instead only install the
python3-nova library package and rely on the service files OSA manages.

The nova_service_distro_packages can be cleaned up further since most
packages are provided as dependencies. uwsgi packages are only required
on hosts running nova-api-os-compute or nova-api-metadata, so an
additional key, 'nova_api' has been added for these hosts under
'nova_service_extra_distro_packages'.

Beginning in the Stein release, Ubuntu distro packages are now using
Python3. This requires additionally installing and using the uwsgi python3
plugin.

Change-Id: Id0c7b57f0119c5213abdf3505e4644680a78d55e

Unrelated timeout errors'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-06-06 06:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-06 15:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-06-07 16:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-06-10 20:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 13:02:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, commits may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d84cb7938a153bd22a6fae5adbfbf8ec3b819bda)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, commits may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d84cb7938a153bd22a6fae5adbfbf8ec3b819bda)

commit_message:
Sync 'validations/ctlplane-ip-range.yaml' with the new role

To be able to maintain stable branches, the validations in the 'validations'
directory have to be synchronized with the new role created with the
validation framework.

This patch synchronizes the ctlplane-ip-range validation.

Change-Id: Ib0f040bdbae8fa053654f954fc0cb25beea1ce5f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Sync 'validations/tasks/disk_space.yaml' with the new role

To be able to maintain stable branches, the validations in the 'validations'
directory have to be synchronized with the new role created with the
validation framework.

This patch synchronizes the disk-space validation.

Change-Id: I1c8e437606fdd36db9566baf404725115540fa60
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Nagios: Fix read-only-fs

This PS permits read-only filesystems to back the containers by setting
the default to true

Change-Id: Id6bcfd892661c9662fff589768862ab3a0520f2b

i think the logic is more or less corrrect so +1 but i have one question in line.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-16 21:16:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Downvote is for the duplicated confirm_resize. I guess this isn't breaking the world because of [1], but it should still be removed.

Is a functional test possible for this?

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L3949"}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-05-19 15:21:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(5 comments)

Will upload PS soon.

in regards to functional tests, im not sure what we will gain from it as the issue occurs on resize/cold-migration of an instance with a hardware offloaded SR-IOV port (during the confirm resize phase).

The unit-test cover's the bug from a logical POV, an integration test which makes sure the correct VF representor was un-plugged from integration bridge during confirm resize also make sense but requires special hardware."}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-05-19 15:50:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-05-19 18:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck

Obviously the specialized hardware gets mocked; but the rest of the flows should be possible within the functional test framework."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-05-19 23:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Allow driver to properly unplug VIFs on destination on confirm resize

Update PCI related VIFs with the original PCI address on the source
host to allow the virt driver to properly unplug VIFs from
hypervisor, e.g allow the proper VF representor to be unplugged
from the integration bridge in case of a hardware offloaded OVS.

While other approaches are possible for solving the issue,
The approach proposed in the series allows the fix to be safely
backported.

Change-Id: Id3c4d839fb1a6da47cfb366b65c0904d281a218f
Closes-Bug: #1809095

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 10:14:45.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 28b90f6c14659500694f321eedbf313d83a2ae9c.

Change-Id: I26b5e8c35233718d97e58cfd5735c62d1684b4b0
Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 28b90f6c14659500694f321eedbf313d83a2ae9c.

Change-Id: I26b5e8c35233718d97e58cfd5735c62d1684b4b0
Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d

commit_message:
Add {{role.name}}RemovalPoliciesMode parameter

This adds a new paramter to reset/update existing blacklisted nodes
set prior to this update with either node delete or using parameter
{{role.name}}RemovalPolicies.

Change-Id: I870d7605e35a7cda76d9de0e8830a87c898533d6

Do not completely understand this change; some questions:

There is a difference between local and remote files. Is there some reason why they are not handled in the same way? E.g. have a schema handler for 'file://' that takes care about the local files?

When I understand this correctly, the dependencies are resolved for the local elements only. Why is this done? I can imagine that it might be very helpful to do this also for remote ones.

Maybe it would be good to call the (new) logging config init in main?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-28 08:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-06-28 16:02:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Abstracting the local elements is interesting. It might be odd since URI's are generally context insensitive and our local elements are only useful with a corresponding elements path env var. Maybe part of the dependency resolution should be to explode local elements into file:// uri's which are then passed to this?


re: remote dependencies - I intentionally left that out because this needs more thought IMO and allowing people to specify uri's in element-deps is going to lead to a packaging ecosystem nightmare. One of the big issues being that it will be impossible for someone to mirror the needed elements reliably. When we want to take the plunge to support dependencies in remote elements I think were going to need to have a fun discussion about element repository hosting, so I am just trying to push that off until later."}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-06-28 16:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-06-28 16:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-28 16:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

 > are adding support and that its not a small change. Might also want
 > to have a release note for this.

Unlike some of the other projects, we haven't been much in the way of using blueprints. We do have a specs process with some specs under review, so a spec could be added.

We also typically compile release notes per release rather than per change."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

commit_message:
Add support for remote element repos

This adds the ability to directy use remote repositories containing dib
elements as part of a disk-image-create command. Support is added only
for git repositories at the moment but the syntax should support
arbitrary repo types.

Change-Id: I8eef974b9ecd0e126b7afb9cb4e61b5796054dd9

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

suffix that are compatible to the SemVer specification (e.g. 1.2.3-rc1).

number of commits from the last tag.

commit_message:
Allow git-tags to be SemVer compliant

This fix allows it to use git-tags with a pre-release suffix that
follows the SemVer specification (e.g. 1.2.3-rc1).

Change-Id: Ie2e3c0e4145a105aff0a35c8dc6ec2a0cc1fc04e

[{'created': '2019-06-07 18:01:49.000000000', 'message': "Remove finish_revert_migration TypeError try/except

In I51cdcae67be8c68a55bc939de4ea0aba2361dcc4 we changed the method
signature of the ComputeDriver's finish_revert_migration() method. As
a courtesy to out of tree drivers, and in preparation for an eventual
backport, the new call was placed in a
try/except to handle any out of tree drivers that hadn't updated. The
old call was used as fallback. This patch removes this, as it's not
needed on master.

Change-Id: Ib9e40f66549e259076eca285e8a801455e07024c
"}, {'created': '2019-06-10 19:53:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove finish_revert_migration TypeError try/except

signature of the ComputeDriver's finish_revert_migration() method. As
a courtesy to out of tree drivers, and in preparation for an eventual
backport, the new call was placed in a
try/except to handle any out of tree drivers that hadn't updated. The

Change-Id: Ib9e40f66549e259076eca285e8a801455e07024c

commit_message:
Remove finish_revert_migration TypeError try/except

In I51cdcae67be8c68a55bc939de4ea0aba2361dcc4 we changed the method
signature of the ComputeDriver's finish_revert_migration() method. As
a courtesy to out of tree drivers, and in preparation for an eventual
backport, the new call was placed in a
try/except to handle any out of tree drivers that hadn't updated. The
old call was used as fallback. This patch removes this, as it's not
needed on master.

Change-Id: Ib9e40f66549e259076eca285e8a801455e07024c

commit_message:
Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I03679fa9f097080250668ca3cc92d4360e5d2494
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/

glance_store 0.29.0 introduced backwards incompatible change
breaking multi-store feature that was supposed to be included in
1.0.0 release without any mention in release notes. Revert is in
process and 0.29.1 will be released after. 0.29.0 should not be
used.

Change-Id: Ia7c7d9ee62386be48a91d5102c9a71fb9074ae68
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use glance_store 0.29.0

glance_store 0.29.0 introduced backwards incompatible change
breaking multi-store feature that was supposed to be included in
1.0.0 release without any mention in release notes. Revert is in
process and 0.29.1 will be released after. 0.29.0 should not be
used.

Change-Id: Ia7c7d9ee62386be48a91d5102c9a71fb9074ae68

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 19:29:38.000000000', 'message': "Load extra variables correctly in wrapper

The extra variables are meant to be loaded contextually if ansible
or ansible-playbook are executed in the OSA playbooks dir, or if the
openstack-ansible wrapper is explicitly called.

This is occurring correctly for openstack-ansible and ansible-playbook,
but extra vars are not being loaded correctly (despite being output
to console as if they're being loaded) when ad-hoc ansible commands
are run in the OSA context.

Change-Id: I023871df159413f9313d7a85820a50872da2b36b
(cherry picked from commit cb26d9a3fd6eb8265d60ae10cdef649f95ddeaa3)
"}]
commit_message:
Load extra variables correctly in wrapper

The extra variables are meant to be loaded contextually if ansible
or ansible-playbook are executed in the OSA playbooks dir, or if the
openstack-ansible wrapper is explicitly called.

This is occurring correctly for openstack-ansible and ansible-playbook,
but extra vars are not being loaded correctly (despite being output
to console as if they're being loaded) when ad-hoc ansible commands
are run in the OSA context.

Change-Id: I023871df159413f9313d7a85820a50872da2b36b
(cherry picked from commit cb26d9a3fd6eb8265d60ae10cdef649f95ddeaa3)

commit_message:
Place upper bound on python-dracclient version

The idrac hardware type requires python-dracclient versions greater than
or equal to 1.3.0 and less than 2.0.0.

This is not a backport of a similar change which merged on the master
and stable/stein branches [1]. That change specifies python-dracclient
versions greater than or equal to 1.5.0 and less than 3.0.0 are
required.

Subsequently, a change which merged only on master modified the bounds
to greater than or equal to 3.0.0 and less than 4.0.0 [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I5f6d6be53aec9d72e8ba5cfa436f12e01966f871
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/634903/

Change-Id: If5b0c5b69f0f8759136051072c1ff53c6d86217d

[{'created': '2019-06-07 18:15:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add "functional tests" documentation

Stop using pbr sphinx integration

generated api docs.

commit_message:
Make OVS controller inactivity_probe configurable

This parameter applies to the OVSDB Controller table when the
native openflow driver is used. There are reports that increasing
it can reduce errors on busy systems. This patch also sets the
default value to 10s which is more than the OVS default of 5s.
See the ovs-vswitchd.conf.db man page for full description.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: If0d42919412dac75deb4d7f484c42cea630fbc59
Partial-Bug: #1817022
(cherry picked from commit 540d00f68ecf1c11b0296922f965ef60d15d1a86)
(cherry picked from commit 6e661ecd2de3994de25af0337f7e2ae781c2cca9)
(cherry picked from commit eaad77758daeefb69bd60d48b8ca1e2814604f8a)

[{'created': '2019-05-08 13:32:04.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6
and commit 7fdd6adc7acf99e74fbe1c12606f8c867ae134ae.

commit_message:
Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6
and commit 7fdd6adc7acf99e74fbe1c12606f8c867ae134ae.

Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
Change-Id: I5ff03b5ad8af432a9f7919ef953d7d8c434b93bd

commit_message:
Add headers to allow the inline script for SSO redirect.

The script sha256 needs to be present to allow the browser to run the
script with the CSP.

The sha is for the Javascript code of the sso_callback_template:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/etc/sso_callback_template.html#L17-L19


Change-Id: I7dd383fcc20c8b46e8e713b28d23e9c9e45679c2

commit_message:
Ensure DNS configuration from conf

For internal DNS the DNS configuration including the search
path should be derived from configuration rather than from
the dns_domain attribute of the network, which is used for
external DNS integration.

Update test to ensure that configuration based dns domain
is present in the server search path and is used to validate
resolution of the hostname of the server.

This commit also temporaily skips the internal DNS test whilst
the associated Neutron reviews are landed; it will be re-enabled
afterwards.

Change-Id: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
Related-Bug: 1826419
Required-By: I5ff03b5ad8af432a9f7919ef953d7d8c434b93bd

[{'created': '2018-11-27 22:05:40.000000000', 'message': 'failover: create new amphora if none exist

If a failover does not cleanly complete, it is possible that the
failover does nothing because there are no amphoras linked.

This patch creates an amphora in the event that there is no amphora
assigned to the load balancer in order to ensure a successful
failover.

Change-Id: I893720c16bb1adc52740890437a76dd4e42a0225
Story: #2004440
Task: #28108
'}]
commit_message:
failover: create new amphora if none exist

If a failover does not cleanly complete, it is possible that the
failover does nothing because there are no amphoras linked.

This patch creates an amphora in the event that there is no amphora
assigned to the load balancer in order to ensure a successful
failover.

Change-Id: I893720c16bb1adc52740890437a76dd4e42a0225
Story: #2004440
Task: #28108

As far as I can tell, the nova in devstack/tempest/grenade does not exercise/touch CORS so unless we are thinking this change is going to magically turn CORS on (it won't) there should be no impact."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-05-30 00:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-10 13:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-29 09:32:22.000000000', 'message': "Modernize CORS config and setup

In the early days of placement, the CORS middleware's config
options were registered out of band with other options, probably
due to efforts to use non-global config and avoid conflicts with
nova's use of the same settings. Now that placement always uses
non-global config, we can change setup back to something more
normal.

At the same time a gap in header-visibility defaults is corrected.

The updated test confirms header visibility. When the 'allow_headers'
configuration setting in fixtures/gabbits.py is removed, it fails.

Change-Id: I8481b3016de19e1617810cb3d3efa092560dfbb7
"}]
commit_message:
Modernize CORS config and setup

In the early days of placement, the CORS middleware's config
options were registered out of band with other options, probably
due to efforts to use non-global config and avoid conflicts with
nova's use of the same settings. Now that placement always uses
non-global config, we can change setup back to something more
normal.

At the same time a gap in header-visibility defaults is corrected.

The updated test confirms header visibility. When the 'allow_headers'
configuration setting in fixtures/gabbits.py is removed, it fails.

Change-Id: I8481b3016de19e1617810cb3d3efa092560dfbb7

commit_message:
Sync 'validations/nova-event-callback.yaml' with the new role

To be able to maintain stable branches, the validations in the 'validations'
directory have to be synchronized with the new role created with the
validation framework.

This patch synchronizes the nova-event-callback validation.

Change-Id: If2cc183ee55f8385475c706eb2ceb6178cf2e00f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add nova::metadata::dhcp_domain

The dhcp_domain setting is not deprecated, however the old
DEFAULT/dhcp_domain setting was because it was moved to api/dhcp_domain.
nova::network::neutron::dhcp_domain will be removed later in the cycle.

Change-Id: I4ce56dc7ee66fc40e5a9a53692c01a5e0f13d633

commit_message:
Add dates for the 'U' Election.

We don't have an approved name for the U series yet so use 'u-TBA'.
This can trivially be updated once the name is set

Setting Combined Election
Summit is at: 2019-11-04
Release is at: 2019-10-14
Latest possible completion is at: 2019-09-23
Moving back to Tuesday: 2019-09-17
TC Election from 2019-09-10T23:45 to 2019-09-17T23:45
PTL Election from 2019-09-10T23:45 to 2019-09-17T23:45
TC Campaigning from 2019-09-03T23:45 to 2019-09-10T23:45
TC Nominations from 2019-08-27T23:45 to 2019-09-03T23:45
PTL Nominations from 2019-08-27T23:45 to 2019-09-03T23:45
Set email_deadline to 2019-09-03T00:00
Setting TC timeframe end to email_deadline
Beginning of Stein Cycle @ 2018-08-10 00:00:00+00:00
End of Train cycle @ 2019-09-03 00:00:00+00:00
Election timeframe: 389 days, 0:00:00s

Change-Id: I6ce85f187bc233c0b5f40da0b75cd297e6cab9a7

commit_message:
Use python3 by default for testenvs

We need to be testing on python3 by default now. This switches the
docs, pep8, and genconfig testenvs to use python3.

Change-Id: I6d21e240e8b1c21698004fbe9e957476b7982c75

messages:
[{'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2019-06-06 05:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2019-06-06 07:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-06-06 11:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi Karthik,

This is good and looks almost ready to merge, but would you please update tools/yaml-validate.py so that it checks that the compute services listed are consistent with other Compute services aside from how this new role differs from those compute services. This will ensure that future changes which all compute roles need will fail CI until they also get into this role.  An example of doing this for a new HCI compute role is at [1].

Thanks,
  John

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/e5cda83954fb08d0e7089d4ae4dad9d190d7c6d8'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2019-06-06 17:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2019-06-06 17:52:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2019-06-07 01:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2019-06-07 04:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-06-07 11:56:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

A diff -u of the the ServicesDefault list of ComputeHCI vs ComputeHCIOvsDpdk role is the below. 

- Why is Tuned not being used? I see we're passing a TunedProfileName so don't we need Tuned? 
- Removing OvsAgent and Vpp and LinuxBridge make sense to me from a high level since this is a profile for OVSDpdk

Should Tuned be added back? If so, I think this is ready to merge.

@@ -11,7 +11,7 @@
     - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronCorePlugin
     - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronL3Agent
     - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent
-    - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronOvsAgent
+    - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronOvsDpdk
     - OS::TripleO::Services::Docker
     - OS::TripleO::Services::Fluentd
     - OS::TripleO::Services::IpaClient
@@ -22,8 +22,6 @@
     - OS::TripleO::Services::MetricsQdr
     - OS::TripleO::Services::MySQLClient
     - OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronBgpVpnBagpipe
-    - OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronLinuxbridgeAgent
-    - OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronVppAgent
     - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaCompute
     - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirt
     - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirtGuests
@@ -42,7 +40,5 @@
     - OS::TripleO::Services::Timezone
     - OS::TripleO::Services::TripleoFirewall
     - OS::TripleO::Services::TripleoPackages
-    - OS::TripleO::Services::Tuned
-    - OS::TripleO::Services::Vpp
     - OS::TripleO::Services::OVNController
     - OS::TripleO::Services::OVNMetadataAgent"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-06-07 13:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2019-06-08 16:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks John.
For roles involving OVS-DPDK, the tuned services will be applied in pre-network config and hence the Tuned services enabled here would be duplicate.
Reference: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/roles/ComputeOvsDpdk*.yaml'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2019-06-09 12:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30526, 'date': '2019-06-10 01:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-06-10 02:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-06-10 16:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Thanks John.
 > For roles involving OVS-DPDK, the tuned services will be applied in
 > pre-network config and hence the Tuned services enabled here would
 > be duplicate.
 > Reference: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/roles/ComputeOvsDpdk*.yaml

ack, ok, thanks.'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-06-06 14:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-06-06 17:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2019-06-06 17:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-06-06 19:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2019-06-10 15:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 14:43:36.000000000', 'message': "Nagios: Use helm-toolkit template renderer for config files

This updates the Nagios chart to use the helm-toolkit template
renderer snippet for generating the Nagios configuration files.
This was done to make the exposure of the configuration files
simpler for those who are more familiar with traditional Nagios
configuration files, as well as allowing for values overrides for
adding custom host names or custom object definitions to nagios
objects (as Nagios doesn't easily allow for this via environment
accessible macros).

Change-Id: I84d5c83d84d6438af5f3ab57997e80e8b1fc8312
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-06-06 17:47:55.000000000', 'message': "Nagios: Use helm-toolkit template renderer for config files

commit_message:
Nagios: Use helm-toolkit template renderer for config files

This updates the Nagios chart to use the helm-toolkit template
renderer snippet for generating the Nagios configuration files.
This was done to make the exposure of the configuration files
simpler for those who are more familiar with traditional Nagios
configuration files, as well as allowing for values overrides for
adding custom host names or custom object definitions to nagios
objects (as Nagios doesn't easily allow for this via environment
accessible macros).

Change-Id: I84d5c83d84d6438af5f3ab57997e80e8b1fc8312
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

Add Vault Secret Store Plugin

Barbican can utilize Hashicorp Vault software
as a secret store backend. Added a new plugin
manifest to configure the vault_plugin section.

commit_message:
Switch to tempest_pip_install_args

We have tempest_pip_install_args to pass additional
args to python_venv_build role for tempest. Let's use it
instead of pip_install_options.

Change-Id: Ie0299fdd9147aaf8162c3d094d7d619e75652528
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
sync: use proposal-bot + gerrit ssh API to pull projects

With the transition to OpenDev, we cannot rely on the old URLs
and this is a much cleaner solution that leverages the proposa-bot
user to get all the information we need.

Change-Id: Ie5dae335c12e178928186637b7b73f97c6a694ab

commit_message:
sync: use proposal-bot + gerrit ssh API to pull projects

With the transition to OpenDev, we cannot rely on the old URLs
and this is a much cleaner solution that leverages the proposa-bot
user to get all the information we need.

Change-Id: Ie5dae335c12e178928186637b7b73f97c6a694ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-21 08:20:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix switch connection destination when a rabbitmq cluster node disappear

In a clustered rabbitmq when a node disappears, we get a
ConnectionRefusedError because the socket get disconnected.

The socket access yields a OSError because the heartbeat
tries to reach an unreachable host (No route to host).

Catch these exceptions to ensure that we call ensure_connection for switching
the connection destination.

POC is available at github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc

Example:
    $ git clone git@github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ cd rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ python -m virtualenv .
    $ source bin/activate
    $ pip install -r requirements.txt
    $ sudo podman run -d --hostname my-rabbit --name rabbit rabbitmq:3
    $ python poc.py $(sudo podman inspect rabbit | niet '.[0].NetworkSettings.IPAddress')

And in parallele in an another shell|tmux
    $ podman stop rabbit
    $ # observe the output of the poc.py script we now call ensure_connection

Now you can observe some output relative to the connection who is
modified and not catched before these changes.

Related to: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1665399

Closes-Bug: #1828841

Change-Id: I9dc1644cac0e39eb11bf05f57bde77dcf6d42ed3
(cherry picked from commit 9d8b1430e5c081b081c0e3c0b5f12f744dc7809d)

commit_message:
Fix switch connection destination when a rabbitmq cluster node disappear

In a clustered rabbitmq when a node disappears, we get a
ConnectionRefusedError because the socket get disconnected.

The socket access yields a OSError because the heartbeat
tries to reach an unreachable host (No route to host).

Catch these exceptions to ensure that we call ensure_connection for switching
the connection destination.

POC is available at github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc

Example:
    $ git clone git@github.com:4383/rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ cd rabbitmq-oslo_messging-error-poc
    $ python -m virtualenv .
    $ source bin/activate
    $ pip install -r requirements.txt
    $ sudo podman run -d --hostname my-rabbit --name rabbit rabbitmq:3
    $ python poc.py $(sudo podman inspect rabbit | niet '.[0].NetworkSettings.IPAddress')

And in parallele in an another shell|tmux
    $ podman stop rabbit
    $ # observe the output of the poc.py script we now call ensure_connection

Now you can observe some output relative to the connection who is
modified and not catched before these changes.

Related to: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1665399

Closes-Bug: #1828841

Change-Id: I9dc1644cac0e39eb11bf05f57bde77dcf6d42ed3
(cherry picked from commit 9d8b1430e5c081b081c0e3c0b5f12f744dc7809d)

[{'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2019-06-07 09:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-06-10 03:57:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

What do we get from this change? It doesn't seem like a huge optimisation because such operations are relatively rare. However, we blow up the code and make it less generic. Can you elaborate on that?"}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2019-06-10 06:45:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> What do we get from this change? It doesn't seem like a huge
 > optimisation because such operations are relatively rare. However,
 > we blow up the code and make it less generic. Can you elaborate on
 > that?

I disagree with statement that this option is rare. There are a lot of cases, when user generates workflow right before its execution, so it is very important to not spend any extra time doing redundant job.

We should understand, that flows could be huge, it is not OK to spend additional 5 seconds to convertation every time we load flow."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-06-10 07:39:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok. I'm ok with the idea of the patch. I'd rather try to find a bit more elegant solution. Please think."}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2019-06-10 08:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-06-10 08:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2019-06-10 09:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2019-06-10 11:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Simple optimization of creating/updating workflows

In case we load definition of one workflow, there is no need to convert
it to yaml and back.

Change-Id: Ia7fb914843e56650c8f6ff5e8c16d1b57001c0fc
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
release tooz 1.65.0 to uncap grpcio

This will allow the constraint on grpcio to be updated as it's currently
blocked on a cap on the version of grpcio that can be installed.

Change-Id: Id5de482ec90bf0ae5b1365c7905d776c886ef4d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 15:20:40.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary joins in InstanceGroup.get_hosts

The InstanceList.get_by_filters query is joining on
info_cache, security_groups, metadata and system_metadata
because of how instance_get_all_by_filters_sort in the DB API
works if columns_to_join (expected_attrs) is None. The get_hosts
method only cares about the instance.host value of its members
so those joins are unnecessarily expensive.

This change simply passes expected_attrs=[] to get_by_filters
to avoid the joins. A follow up change can further optimize this
code by adding a new query method to just get the host values
for a list of instance uuids, so a TODO is left in place for that.
Note that a new query method would need to be remotable and thus
not something we can backport.

Change-Id: I53d4b38d12404a1641f667c537404effa837a83d
Partial-Bug: #1830234
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary joins in InstanceGroup.get_hosts

The InstanceList.get_by_filters query is joining on
info_cache, security_groups, metadata and system_metadata
because of how instance_get_all_by_filters_sort in the DB API
works if columns_to_join (expected_attrs) is None. The get_hosts
method only cares about the instance.host value of its members
so those joins are unnecessarily expensive.

This change simply passes expected_attrs=[] to get_by_filters
to avoid the joins. A follow up change can further optimize this
code by adding a new query method to just get the host values
for a list of instance uuids, so a TODO is left in place for that.
Note that a new query method would need to be remotable and thus
not something we can backport.

Change-Id: I53d4b38d12404a1641f667c537404effa837a83d
Partial-Bug: #1830234

Please skip this patch set 8, I made a mistake and what I wanted to submitted didn't gotten submitted."}, {'account_id': 19243, 'date': '2018-02-27 21:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-03-01 11:50:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I realize that this change will use one new OVS bridge per network. I think that a better design would be to have a single OVS bridge for L3 processing, relying on OVS registers to identify the router into which the packet is processed.

Also, I think this change would need to include a devref documenting the design of this approach.

Because of the above, I'm marking -1 here, but I fully support the idea of having an OVS implementation of DVR."}, {'account_id': 19243, 'date': '2018-03-02 04:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 18051, 'date': '2018-03-07 17:46:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Re: Thomas Morin;
The patch creates an OpenvSwitch bridge per router and only when that router is connected to a network (Just wanted to clarify that before moving on).
It can be done, the only concern I have is the quantity of patch ports that would be created between two bridges. For each interface between a router and a network a patch port gets created between the dvr_br and the int_br. This gets noticed by the neutron ovs-l2-agent and adds the vlan information for that network to the patch port, in this way no modifications are needed to the integration bridge with the exception of the added patch ports, I'm not sure how this would behave on a single bridge compared to a 1:1 mapping of bridges to routers.

The other thing is the sheer complexity of the bridge if all the flows of multiple routers are made in the one place. It would make debugging excessively complicated to try to parse out just the information relevant to a single router.

But maybe this is something that can be brought up at the l3-meeting on Thursdays as it does address a concern that there may be an excessive number of OVS bridges created on a host by this feature."}, {'account_id': 28059, 'date': '2018-05-31 17:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I'll update all these patches with the Partially-Implements once master neutron relaxes a bit so I can confidently resolve the recent conflicts."}, {'account_id': 15070, 'date': '2019-04-19 01:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

With our continues development of DVR – Openflow solution and the evolution of OVN, we have done some analysis. The feature set in OVN is richer than the current DVR solution & is gaining momentum in the community. So we are intending to transition our DVR efforts to OVN and stop further development in DVR. We believe this will better help community and networking project. Intel will be glad to help customers transition from DVR to OVN. Let us know if you have any feedback to us.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-05-23 01:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

- Installation settings in devstack:
[[post-config|$NEUTRON_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins=neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin
router_distributed=True
[[post-config|/$Q_L3_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
agent_mode=dvr_bridge
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
[[post-config|/$Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
force_metadata=True
enable_isolated_metadata=True
[[post-config|/$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE]]
[ml2]
types_drivers = vxlan,flat
tenant_network_types = vxlan
extension_drivers = port_security,qos
mechanism_drivers = openvswitch,l2population
[ml2_type_flat]
flat_networks = public
[agent]
l2_population=True
tunnel_types=vxlan
enable_distributed_routing=True
extensions=qos
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
of_interface=ovs-ofctl
local_ip=$HOST_IP

- East/West enabled on IPV4
- North/South enabled on IPV4

'}, {'created': '2018-02-26 23:43:59.000000000', 'message': '[POC] Introduction of OpenFlow implementation of DVR.

- East/West enabled on IPV4
- North/South enabled on IPV4
- Static routes enabled on IPV4
- floating IP enabled on IPV4

- IPV6 requires changes to Open vSwitch to modify the reserved field on icmpv6.

- Installation settings in devstack:
[[post-config|$NEUTRON_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins=neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin
router_distributed=True
[[post-config|/$Q_L3_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
agent_mode=dvr_bridge
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
[[post-config|/$Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
force_metadata=True
enable_isolated_metadata=True
[[post-config|/$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE]]
[ml2]
types_drivers = vxlan,flat
tenant_network_types = vxlan
extension_drivers = port_security,qos
mechanism_drivers = openvswitch,l2population
[ml2_type_flat]
flat_networks = public
[agent]
l2_population=True
tunnel_types=vxlan
enable_distributed_routing=True
extensions=qos
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
of_interface=ovs-ofctl
local_ip=$HOST_IP

Change-Id: Iac79212823d15feb0f530f84a66ffe47bbaacca1
Signed-off-by: otcnsw6 <david.j.chou@intel.com>

commit_message:
[POC] Introduction of OpenFlow implementation of DVR

- East/West enabled on IPV4
- North/South enabled on IPV4
- Static routes enabled on IPV4
- floating IP enabled on IPV4
- Enable dvr-bridge routers to inherit integration bridge datapath type

- IPV6 requires changes to Open vSwitch to modify the reserved field on icmpv6.

- Installation settings in devstack:
[[post-config|$NEUTRON_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins=neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin
router_distributed=True
[[post-config|/$Q_L3_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
agent_mode=dvr_bridge
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
[[post-config|/$Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
force_metadata=True
enable_isolated_metadata=True
[[post-config|/$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE]]
[ml2]
types_drivers = vxlan,flat
tenant_network_types = vxlan
extension_drivers = port_security,qos
mechanism_drivers = openvswitch,l2population
[ml2_type_flat]
flat_networks = public
[agent]
l2_population=True
tunnel_types=vxlan
enable_distributed_routing=True
extensions=qos
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
of_interface=ovs-ofctl
local_ip=$HOST_IP

Co-Authored-By: Xubo Zhang <xubo.zhang@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Igor D.C. <igor.duarte.cardoso@intel.com>

Change-Id: Iac79212823d15feb0f530f84a66ffe47bbaacca1

commit_message:
Implement QoS OpenFlowFunction for DSCP

OpenFlowFunctions interact with the OpenFlowManager
to provide interoperabilty between extensions.
This change registers the QoS DscpMarkingRule in this pipeline.

- Creates the QosDscpOpenFlowFunction to place DSCP flows into the
  OpenFlowManager's pipeline and subsequent tests.

Change-Id: Ief337e1ca2c46087d7f3fbae07aaaf3afa3150de
Depends-On: Ifd13ab6757b479f624d2c7d7deef3b2a3fddf457
Co-Authored-By: rui.zang@intel.com

comments below to reflect the discussion at the PTG this morning (with mlavalle, davidsha and myself)

One thing that we discussed is the idea that it would make sense, along with this work, to define the network OVS register and port OVS register (reg5 and reg6) as currently used by the openvswitch firewall driver,  in the base ovs_agent_code rather than in the ovsfw code. Many/all functions managed by the OpenFlowManager will need  this information.

And The register allocation routine will need to preserve these register from being allocated to something else.'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2018-03-03 06:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

Hi guys, thanks for the review and discussing it on PTG.
I have been doing a refactoring in which the registering of OpenFlowFunction and OpenFlowBridge are changed from statically by decorator to a dynamic way.

I have uploaded the PoC code here if you want to have a look. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549392/

This will get rid of importing ovs qos driver code in qos agent extension. 

If this goes right, most of the test cases need rewritten. That is why this lags so long.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2018-03-03 06:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

commit_message:
L2 openflow manager

- add dynamic pipeline creation per bridge.
- add dynamic table assignment to flow table.
- chain tables together similar to a linked list.
- Feature prioritisation enabled.
- Request registers for extensions.
- spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320439

bug: #1563967
Change-Id: Ifd13ab6757b479f624d2c7d7deef3b2a3fddf457
Co-Authored-By: rui.zang@intel.com

[{'created': '2019-06-06 01:54:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix package name of the OpenStack client

The package python3-openstackclient should be installed instead of
python-openstackclient for OpenStack Stein for Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.

commit_message:
Fix package name of the OpenStack client

The package python3-openstackclient should be installed instead of
python-openstackclient for OpenStack Stein for Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I2ceaf0237e7a6ac9dc3f4a994cf0989d93b290de
Closes-Bug: #1831819

commit_message:
[ironic] Create milestone-1 releases

This is a procedural review to create new releases for libraries following cycle-with-intermediary  model with code changes

Teams should update this change as appropriate

Change-Id: Ie06772b7594f1bc8c27d4350efb98ce146c1b296

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 10:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: solution 2 of convey image size to glance

When uploading volume to image, glance backend need to resize multiple
times, and this impacts performance. This is the solution 2 to solve
this issue: update the image size after creating image but before
uploading data.

The solution in below BP is solution 1 which convey the image size via
HTTP header, in the same HTTP request with image data.

Implements: blueprint specify-image-size-to-avoid-backend-resize
Closes-Bug: #1792710

Change-Id: Ic60e85a4f9ac1ec945852cf5bece8fcdcac0404c
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 14:46:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: solution 2 of convey image size to glance

When uploading volume to image, glance backend need to resize multiple
times, and this impacts performance. This is the solution 2 to solve
this issue: update the image size after creating image but before
uploading data.

The solution in below BP is solution 1 which convey the image size via
HTTP header, in the same HTTP request with image data.

Implements: blueprint specify-image-size-to-avoid-backend-resize
Closes-Bug: #1792710

Change-Id: Ic60e85a4f9ac1ec945852cf5bece8fcdcac0404c
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-04-18 08:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Convey image size to glance

When uploading volume to image, glance backend need to resize multiple times,
and this impacts performance. This patch is to solve this issue by: update the
image size after creating image but before uploading data.

Closes-Bug: #1792710

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609997
Change-Id: Ic60e85a4f9ac1ec945852cf5bece8fcdcac0404c
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Convey image size to glance

When uploading volume to image, glance backend need to resize multiple times,
and this impacts performance. This patch is to solve this issue by: update the
image size after creating image but before uploading data.

Closes-Bug: #1792710

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609997
Change-Id: Ic60e85a4f9ac1ec945852cf5bece8fcdcac0404c
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

Pin ARA to <1.0.0

ARA 1.0 will be released in the near future and isn't backwards
compatible. Pin it so it doesn't break things unexpectedly.

commit_message:
Move FS_TYPE set post-element source

This is a workaround for RHEL 8 image builds not booting on ext4 file
systems. For now, we default RHEL 8 builds to XFS unless explicitely
instructed otherwise by the user with FS_TYPE.

Related-Bug: #1831883

Change-Id: Iedc17db1d169256169f027971dabe2df1a467011

commit_message:
Reduce number of fields in notification data

It is very important to prevent sending huge messages via rpc.
Notification data has a lot of potentially large fields, such as output,
spec and etc. Most of them are useless as a part of notification message
so we should omit them.

Change-Id: I0762a465742fcb1d1dc8d4d00d81cf8288b842ca
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Delete delayed calls for deleted entities

Delayed calls for nonexistent entities should not fail; they should do
nothing and be deleted in normal way.

Change-Id: I1b818d671468b95ce8ae06416b57fd4a22cc6eb2
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Enable scenario tests with CEPHFS

Allow running api and scenario tests
together in the manila test jobs.

Change-Id: Ifbf998d7c8a27ad22a39f46547d1548c052614d0

Add olso.middleware.cors to conf generator

CORS configuration settings are available to placement, so we
should include them in the sample and docs.

Change-Id: I15587af6a302f87b4159c819a8046ab489b684ea
